org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic

Class NodeTaskRef<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic.NodeTaskRef<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - the return type of the task nodes

    public final class NodeTaskRef<R>
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines the fully built task of a node.

    Thread safety

    The properties of a NodeTaskRef can be safely used by multiple threads concurrently. However, the compute method may not be called multiple times (implying that it cannot be called by multiple threads concurrently).

    Synchronization transparency

    The getProperties method is synchronization transparent but the compute method is not.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeTaskRef

        public NodeTaskRef(TaskNodeProperties properties,
                   CancelableFunction<? extends R> task)
        Creates a NodeTaskRef with the given properties and task action.
        Parameters:
        properties - the properties of the task node associated with this task. This argument cannot be null.
        task - the task action of the associated task node. This argument cannot be null.

    • Method Detail

      • compute

        public R compute(CancellationToken cancelToken)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes the task action and returns its output.

        Note this method may only be called at most once.

        Parameters:
        cancelToken - the CancellationToken which might signal that the computation is to be canceled. The task may respond to such computation with an OperationCanceledException or can ignore the cancellation and complete the action. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the output of the computation as defined by the associated task node. This method may return null, if the associated task node allows null results.
        Throws:
        OperationCanceledException - thrown if the task detects that it was canceled (usually by checking the provided CancellationToken)
        java.lang.Exception - thrown if some irrecoverable error occurs

      • getProperties

        public TaskNodeProperties getProperties()
        Returns the properties associated with the task node.
        Returns:
        the properties associated with the task node. This method never returns null.
